intro: Anemonospermos dregei, commonly known as the Cape Flats anemone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
